Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton James Hancock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for consolidation of criminal charges

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Colton James Hancock in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests Oconto & Jefferson County cases be consolidated as counts 4-8.  Defendant will enter plea to Cts 1, 4 & 8 of the amended Information.  Counsel will recommend prison on each count with conditions.  Atty Severson agrees.  BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the consolidation of cases from Oconto County and Jefferson County. 
State files Amended Information.  Atty Severson received the Information and waives it's readings.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to Cts 1, 4 & 8 of the Amended Information.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.
  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Cts 1, 4 & 8.  Counts 2, 3, 5, 6 & 7 are ordered dismissed and read-in.  Charges in 15TR442 & 15TR446 are dismissed.
Counsel make sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement to the Court. 
BY THE COURT:  
Ct 1:  Defendant sentenced to 10 years in the Wisconsin Prison System; 5 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent to any other sentence now serving..  Sentence to commence forthwith.  Granted 204 days credit for time already served.
Conditions:  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges of $250.00.  *Pay restitution of $56,035.95, joint and several with Lisa Patton.  *Comply with any assessments as required by the agent and any folloow-up treatment.  *Maintain absolute sobriety - zero tolerance.  *Provide all prescriptions to the agent as soon as they are received.  *No contact with Cory Rentmeester, his immediate family or his home.  *Follow all rules of supervision.  *Comply with random drug/alcohol testing.  *Employment screening and counseling and comply.  *No contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes.
Ct 4:  Defendant sentenced to 8 years in the Wisconsin Prison System; 3 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent to any other sentence..
Conditions:  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges of $250.00.  *Comply with all conditions in Ct 1.
Ct 8:   Defendant sentenced to 8 years in the Wisconsin Prison System; 3 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent to any other sentence.
Conditions:  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges of $250.00.  *Comply with all conditions in Cts 1 & 4.

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

INFORMATION RELATIVE TO A SUBROGATION CLAIM

Defendant Colton James Hancock in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Defendant Colton James Hancock in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR442 & 446 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the matters are not resolved as the defendant has charges in several counties and other States.  Atty Hendee received blood tests recently.  Atty Hendee asks for another date in late October or early November.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Colton James Hancock in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Colton James Hancock in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR442 & 15TR446 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that there has been some discussion on consolidation with other counties.  Atty Klopp states that his client would like to have this resolved as soon as possible.  Atty Klopp asks the court to allow him to withdraw as there have been some disagreement between him and the defendant.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the request to withdraw.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Colton James Hancock in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Colton James Hancock in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also heard with 15TR442 & 15TR446.
Atty Hendee states defendant has charges in other counties.  Atty Klopp states there are charges in 3 other counties.  
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Atty Klopp asks that the court to amend the cash bond to a signature bond as the defendant will be going directly to another county jail to take care of those matters in two other counties.
Atty Bonnett objects to the motion and requests that the cash bond remain the same.

BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the bond is denied; cash bond will remain.

Defendant Colton James Hancock in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Colton James Hancock in custody.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic tickets tracking with:
   Atty Klopp states that the defendant will waive the Prelim and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Bonnett files the information with the Court.  Atty Klopp states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

with conditions:
*No contact with Lisa Patton

Defendant Colton James Hancock in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR442 tracking with:
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests a $25,000 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has had many offenses in other jurisdictions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $25,000 cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Lisa Patton

Court questions the defendant regarding the Preliminary Hearing time limits.  Defendant does not waive the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT: Time limits are not waived; set Prelim.

Defendant has changed his mind and now would like to waive his time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits have now been waived.
Set Prelim.
15TR442 tracking with  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
